Question
========

From a sample of 10 20-year-old men, their lung capacity was determined and the distance they could run in 15 minutes running. The Pearson correlation between these variables was found to be 0.60. The percentage of variation in distance run that is *not* related to lung capacity is then equal to

Answerlist
----------

* 36%
* 40%
* 60%
* 64%

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 36%: Incorrect
* 40%: Incorrect
* 60%: Incorrect
* 64%: Correct
